thread.title: EU's Barnier says still some 25 percent of work to do on Brexit

title: EU's Barnier says still some 25 percent of work to do on Brexit
text:
April 20, 2018 / 6:22 AM / Updated 4 hours ago EU's Barnier says still some 25 percent of work to do on Brexit Reuters Staff 2 Min Read 
PARIS (Reuters) - The European Union’s chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier said on Friday some 25 percent of work remained to be done on a pact covering UK withdrawal from the EU, including crucial issues such as management of the Ireland/Northern Ireland border. European Union chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier meets with members of the Parliamentary Grand Committee in Helsinki, Finland, April 5, 2018. Lehtikuva / Antti Aimo-Koivisto via REUTERS 
“In terms of what has been agreed so far, it’s about 75 percent,” Barnier told France 2 television. 
Even if Britain and the EU were working towards a British exit from the EU taking place in March 2019, risks of failure remained as long as outstanding topics such as Ireland were unresolved, he said. 
“There are always difficulties, and risks of a failure,” said Barnier. 
Some in Britain want “what the English call cherry picking”, he said, adding that the reply to that was “No way”. 
Britain and the EU are committed to keeping a free flow of people and goods over the Irish border without returning to checkpoints which would be a reminder of the three decades of violence largely ended by the Good Friday Agreement of 1998. 
However, no solution has yet been found for any customs checks needed after Brexit and a backstop plan could effectively isolate the Northern Ireland economy from mainland Britain. Reporting by Sudip Kar-Gupta; Editing by Brian Love
